title: Mini Apple Loaf Cakes

ingredients.content: 200 g butter, soft, plus extra for greasing
300 g eating apples, peeled, cored, quartered (approx. 3)
1 lemon, thin peelings of skin and 30 g juice
100 g light brown sugar, plus 1 Tbsp for sprinkling

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 170°C and grease 8 individual mini loaf tins.
Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh in 150 g apple quarters. Remove apples and cut into thin slices (2-3 mm) then return to bowl.
Add to bowl on mixing bowl lid lemon juice, light brown sugar and ½ tsp cinnamon then remove bowl and mix together gently with spatula. Set bowl aside.
Place lemon peel and 30 g flour in mixing bowl then grate <b>30 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add butter, light brown sugar, vanilla sugar and eggs then mix <b>15 sec/speed 4<b>.
Add remaining 150 g apple quarters then chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>.
Add remaining 220 g flour, baking powder and 1 tsp cinnamon then mix <b>15 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then mix again <b>15 sec/speed 4<b>.
Divide mixture between prepared loaf tins, levelling the tops.
Arrange reserved apple slices over the top, overlapping them slightly then sprinkle 1 Tbsp light brown sugar over apples.

Bake for 30-35 minutes (170°C) until golden brown and a skewer inserted in centre comes out clean. Allow to cool in tins for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. Serve once cool.

hintsAndTricks: Braeburn or Cox apples work well in this cake recipe.
